Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure CLI
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure CLI to create an ExpressRoute Direct circuit. This involves specifying the ExpressRoute port, resource group, SKU family, SKU tier, bandwidth, and location.

Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure Portal
Tasks.Task Description: Navigate to the Azure portal, search for ExpressRoute Direct, and follow the steps to create a new ExpressRoute Direct resource by specifying the subscription, resource group, region, and other configuration details.
Generate the LOA for the ExpressRoute Direct resource using the Azure CLI. This document is necessary for setting up the physical connection with the service provider.
Enable or disable the admin state for primary and secondary links of the ExpressRoute Direct port using the Azure CLI.
Track the provisioned and utilized bandwidth for the ExpressRoute Direct circuits to ensure optimal usage and avoid over-provisioning.
Follow the workflow to set up ExpressRoute Direct, including selecting peering locations, configuring bandwidth, and encapsulation types.
Ensure all prerequisites are met before setting up ExpressRoute Direct, including reviewing ExpressRoute locations, connectivity providers, and best practices.
Set up routing for the ExpressRoute circuit, including configuring BGP sessions and ensuring proper route advertisement.
Link a virtual network (VNet) to the ExpressRoute circuit to enable private connectivity between on-premises networks and Azure VNets.
Assess and document the network security requirements for the ExpressRoute Direct setup, including virtual networks, firewalls, and threat protection measures.
Ensure data protection measures are in place, including in-transit encryption, encryption at rest, and data discovery and classification.
Configure access control mechanisms such as object-level security, row-level security, column-level security, and dynamic data masking.
Set up authentication methods for accessing the ExpressRoute Direct resources, including SQL login, Microsoft Entra ID, and multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Implement threat protection measures such as threat detection, auditing, and vulnerability assessment for the ExpressRoute Direct setup.
Familiarize yourself with the key features of ExpressRoute Direct, including large data ingestion, physical isolation, and granular control of circuit distribution.
Learn about the connectivity options available with ExpressRoute Direct, including dual 100-Gbps or 10-Gbps connectivity and Active/Active connectivity at scale.
Develop a detailed plan for implementing ExpressRoute Direct, including timelines, resource allocation, and potential challenges.

Tasks.Task: Evaluate Project Plan for ExpressRoute Direct
Tasks.Task Description: Evaluate the project plan to identify any steps that could lead to blockers or impact the project timeline. Make necessary adjustments to ensure a smooth implementation.
